text:
I have a situation where I need to pass the output of a custom tag into the
attribute of another custom tag.  For example:

<mytags:tag1 someAttr="<mytags:tag2>something</mytags:tag2>"/>

The JSP parser is not parsing the value of someAttr at all.  The attribute has
been set up as rtexprvalue, and passing regular JSP expressions works correctly.

It seems to be that tag2 should be processed before it's sent back to the 
browser.

Note that this problem also exists with <jsp:forward> and <jsp:include> -- 
custom tags cannot be used in the page attribute of these tags.
creator: akerr@fluid.com

text:
This isn't a valid request time attribute value.  The JSP 1.1 spec describes 
request time attribute values in section 2.12.1.  The syntax for the request 
time attribute value is "<%= expr %>" or '<%= %>'.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
